title: Wind Cave National Park: Eating & Sleeping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping             Eating & Sleeping        Elk Mountain Campground NPS Photo   Â    There are no lodging, gasoline, grocery, or restaurant services available in the park. These services are available in the nearby towns of Hot Springs (15 minutes south) and Custer (25 minutes north). For information on lodging and other services in:   Hot Springs - call 605-745-4140 or 800-325-6991   Custer - call 605-673-2244 or 800-992-9818   Camping at Wind Cave The Elk Mountain Campground is open year-round and is the only campground in the park. Sites are first-come, first-served and the campground usually does not fill. Drinking water and flush restrooms are available in the summer months.   Camping Outside the Park Custer State Park, bordering Wind Cave National Park to the north, has campgrounds, restaurants, motels, and some grocery services. Information is available on the Custer State Park website or by calling 605-255-4515. Camping reservations for Custer State Park may be made by calling 800-710-2267. For information about state park lodging, please call 888-875-0001. Numerous campgrounds and cabins are also available throughout the Black Hills National Forest. Reservations can be made through www.recreation.gov or by calling 1-877-444-6777.
